definition: see 吃閉門羹|吃闭门羹[chi1 bi4 men2 geng1]
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
soup
to be refused entrance (idiom)/to find the door closed
to close the door in one's face (idiom)

sentences.english: After the hospital refused several times, Guan decided to sue it.
sentences.chinese: 在醫院吃了幾次閉門羹之後，管禮明決定向法院起訴。

sentences.english: Mike's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 麥可要求調任時，他的老闆賞了他閉門羹。

sentences.english: Tom's boss slammed the door on his request for a job transfer.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆要求調任時，他的老闆讓他吃了閉門羹。

sentences.english: I intended to have a talk with him, but he gave me the cold shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 打算和他好好談談，卻吃了個閉門羹。

sentences.english: I went to visit you yesterday but there's nobody home.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天去你們家玩，可是吃了閉門羹。

sentences.english: I went to see him yesterday, but unfortunately I was to a locked door.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天去他家看他，不想吃了閉門羹。

sentences.english: Did you say anything to him or just shut the door in his face?
sentences.chinese: 你跟他說什麼了嗎，還是直接給了他個閉門羹？

definition: you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
fake drugs
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to smash
to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
bird's nest
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to evade responsibility/to shirk
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to exaggerate
Heaven knows!
